prompt: According to David Deutch, Knowledge is Infinite. According to Nassim Taleb, randomness is unavoidable and unknowable. How do you square that circle?
title: The Paradox of Infinite Knowledge and Unknowable Uncertainty
sceneDescription: A vast library stretches into the distance, the shelves receding to an unseen horizon. A confident scholar, perched on a tall ladder, tucks a new volume into an already bulging section labeled with tidy symbols. In one corner, a cloud of rolling dice floats in midair, scattering in unexpected directions. A second figure stands below, staring at the dice with an air of resigned puzzlement. The contrast between the orderly rows of books and the chaotic jumble of tumbling cubes underlines the paradox of infinite knowledge confronting indeterminable randomness.
